{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3134023,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-26T00:09:47.062Z","cooked":"

Our team is switching over to command based programming using Java this season. We don’t have any experience with the new command based framework and we have run into an issue trying to create autonomous commands. We want to create a command group which has both sequential and parallel commands run within it. Only the first DriveCommand is being run and then the program stops from there. Thank you for the help in advance!

package frc.robot.commands;

import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.InstantCommand;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SequentialCommandGroup;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.ParallelCommandGroup;
import frc.robot.Robot;

import frc.robot.commands.DrivetrainCommands.DriveCommand;
import frc.robot.commands.PneumaticCommands.ClampArmCommand;
import frc.robot.commands.PneumaticCommands.RaiseLowerArmCommand;

public class PickUpCommand extends SequentialCommandGroup{

public PickUpCommand(){
    

    addCommands(
        new SequentialCommandGroup(
            new ClampArmCommand(false)
            )); // opens arm
    
    addCommands(
        new ParallelCommandGroup(
            new DriveCommand(0, 0.5, 0, 1, true), // drive to gamepiece
            new RaiseLowerArmCommand(false) // lowers arm
        ));


    addCommands(
        new SequentialCommandGroup(
            new ClampArmCommand(false), // closes arm around gamepiece
            new RaiseLowerArmCommand(true), // raises gamepiece
            new DriveCommand(0, -0.5, 0, 1, true)
        )); // drives backwards

}

}

The ParallelCommandGroup never ends because RaiseLowerArmCommand never ends. Consider using ParallelDeadlineGroup instead.

Edit: I see that ClampArmCommand doesn’t end either, which makes me wonder how you could have gotten as far as the DriveCommand.

Also, it’s not good practice for your commands to get the subsystems from public static fields on RobotContainer. Make them private non-static in RobotContainer and pass them in to the command constructors as parameters.

Also, it looks like the pneumatic commands could all be instant commands. Plus, it is not necessary to nest the sequential command groups. This could just be a clamp command, followed by the parallel group, and then just the list of other commands without nesting.

Thanks for the help! I got it working today at practice. I made it so the RaiseLowerArmCommand and the ClampArmCommand return true when isFinished().

Edit: We also used the ParallelCommandGroup to end the other commands.

Here is our code that now runs as intended!

public class PickUpCommand extends SequentialCommandGroup{

public PickUpCommand(){
    

    addCommands(new ClampArmCommand(true)); // opens arm
    
    addCommands(
        new ParallelDeadlineGroup(
            new DriveCommand(0.5, 0, 0, 3, true), // drive to gamepiece
            new RaiseLowerArmCommand(false) // lowers arm
        ));


    addCommands(
            new ClampArmCommand(false), // closes arm around gamepiece
            new RaiseLowerArmCommand(true), // raises gamepiece
            new DriveCommand(-0.5, 0, 0, 3, true)
        ); // drives backwards

}

}`

Is the 3 the amount of time it drives? My programmer and I are wanting to implement sequential and parallel commands in auto this year, so I have been looking up as many examples as I can. Thank you in advance.

Yes. This was a custom command we wrote to drive for a certain amount of time with a mecanum drivetrain. This was a test because we were also trying to learn command based last year. Let me know if you have any questions, I would be happy to help!

Have you had any experience with command based? Or are you just trying to learn how sequential and parallel commands work?

Thank you! We learned command based last year, but this is the first time we will be implementing sequential and parallel commands. We get the idea behind using them, but were not sure on how to make a system such as an intake or shooter move for a specified amount of time. This helps a lot.
